title: Boxing news: Fuming David Haye jeered off stage at Tony Bellew press conference in Liverpool | Metro News
text:
KOs: 26 Losses: 2 Bellew to Haye: "The way you've turned up you look completely broke. All you are missing is a copy of the big issue." #HayeBellew pic.twitter.com/3JMUK2b0U2 
— Sheldan Keay (@SheldanKeay) February 27, 2017 
Several war of words broke out before the stand off with each fighter getting the opportunity to speak to the gathered crowd. 
Haye could hardly be heard over the shouting from the crowd, but he urged the Scousers to put their money where their mouth was. 
‘Empty your bank accounts and back your man with all your money,’ said Haye. 
‘Put it on Tony Bellew if you are brave. David Haye arguing with the fans and storms away from the podium. #HayeBellew pic.twitter.com/lVP8ynZVOp 
— Sheldan Keay (@SheldanKeay) February 27, 2017 
‘That really shows your support. If you believe him, every single one of you, bet on him. 
‘If you are sure he is going to win, you will be happy.’ 
Bellew fired back during Haye’s speech sparking an angry reaction from the London-born fighter before Bellew was welcomed to the podium by a raucous reception. Haye arrived to a chorus of boos (Picture: Getty) Haye eventually was the first to leave the stage (Picture: Getty) 
On Saturday night, I’m going to create something that will never die, and that’s a legacy once I beat ‘Sideshow Bob’. 
‘I’m going in with a man who was absolutely fantastic,’ said Bellew. 
‘When David was in his prime, an immense fighter. Boxing fans queued to get into the press conference in Liverpool (Picture: Getty)
